problem:
Compute
\[\sum_{n = 1}^\infty \frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}},\]where $F_n$ denotes the $n$th Fibonacci number, so $F_0 = 0$ and $F_1 = 1.$
solution:
Since $F_{n + 1} = F_{n + 2} - F_n,$
\[\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}} = \frac{F_{n + 2} - F_n}{F_n F_{n + 2}} = \frac{1}{F_n} - \frac{1}{F_{n + 2}}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\sum_{n = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{F_n F_{n + 2}} &= \left( \frac{1}{F_1} - \frac{1}{F_3} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{F_2} - \frac{1}{F_4} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{F_3} - \frac{1}{F_5} \right) + \dotsb \\
&= \frac{1}{F_1} + \frac{1}{F_2} \\
&= \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
model_solution:
## Step 1: We begin by expressing the terms of the series in a different form using the definition of the Fibonacci sequence.
We will use the definition $F_{n + 2} = F_{n + 1} + F_n$ to simplify the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}}.$

## Step 2: We will substitute the definition of $F_{n + 2}$ into the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}}$ to get $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n (F_{n + 1} + F_n)}.$

## Step 3: We will then further simplify the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n (F_{n + 1} + F_n)}$ by expressing it as $\frac{1}{F_n} - \frac{1}{F_{n + 1} + F_n}.$

We will use the definition $F_{n + 2} = F_{n + 1} + F_n$ to simplify the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}}.$

## Step 2: We will substitute the definition of $F_{n + 2}$ into the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n F_{n + 2}}$ to get $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n (F_{n + 1} + F_n)}.$

## Step 3: We will then further simplify the expression $\frac{F_{n + 1}}{F_n (F_{n + 1} + F_n)}$ by expressing it as $\frac{1}{F_n} - \frac{1}{F_{n + 1} + F_n}.$
